meanings.definition: To disassemble a firearm into its basic components for cleaning or maintenance.
meanings.sent1: I fieldstripped my rifle to clean it thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The soldier fieldstripped his gun after a long day at the shooting range.
meanings.sent3: After watching a tutorial, I attempted to fieldstrip my gun but ended up with extra parts!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had fieldstripped her life, breaking it down to its core elements.
meanings.sent5: The process of fieldstripping the gun was intricate but satisfying.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the outer layers or covering of something.
meanings.sent1: The fieldstripped wire revealed the colorful layers underneath.
meanings.sent2: The fieldstripped bark of the tree exposed the smooth wood beneath.
meanings.sent3: The fieldstripped potato looked naked without its skin!
meanings.sent4: The artist used a fieldstripped technique to reveal the hidden beauty of the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The fieldstripped book cover hinted at the intriguing story inside.
